_header: On folly was my silver laid
_description: On youth and old age — 23 lines in 8-line stanzas (abababab)

CULAdd4407c.First Lines:
…On folie was myn silwyr leydAnd folileke it betaghtof
                    fele men I had bredþat we ben sundir saghte…
CULAdd4407c.Last Lines:
…God wot schrewe þe moreAt bissop þe coke ner was mi
                    bed…
CULAdd4407c.Note:
Begins ln. 3 of first stanza; ends incomplete with first line of 4th
                    stanza.
CULAdd4407c.Editions:
Skeat,  Walter William. 
             “‘Elegy on the Death of King Edward I’ from a New
                MS.” 
             Modern Language Review
         7 (1912): 149-52: 151 (lines 7-14 only).
Smithers,  G. V. 
             “Fragment of A Lost Middle English Lyric.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 34 [232] (1987): 453-6: 453-6.
